\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=blue!5!white, colframe=blue!75!black, title=Epistemic Status]
\textbf{Skeleton structure:} \tagDer{} --- dimensional analysis and chain logic \\
\textbf{Parameter mappings:} \tagDc{} --- conditional on mode profiles from BVP \\
\textbf{Numerical values:} \tagOPEN{} --- blocked by BVP solution (OPR-21) \\[0.5em]
\textbf{Goal:} Define a chain from 5D action $\to$ $G_F$ with NO circular $v$ input.
\end{tcolorbox}

% ============================================================================
\section{Step 0: Circularity Audit}

\subsection{The Circular Dependency}

The Standard Model relation:
\begin{equation}
    v = (\sqrt{2} G_F)^{-1/2} = 246.22 \text{ GeV} \quad \tagBL{}
\end{equation}

\textbf{defines} the Higgs VEV from the measured $G_F$. Therefore:

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=red!5!white, colframe=red!75!black, title=Circularity Caveat]
Using $v$ to derive $M_W = gv/2$, then $M_W$ to derive $G_F = g^2/(4\sqrt{2}M_W^2)$
is \textbf{circular}---it returns the input $G_F$ by construction.
\end{tcolorbox}

\subsection{Where Circularity Occurs (File References)}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lll}
\toprule
\textbf{File} & \textbf{Line(s)} & \textbf{Circular Element} \\
\midrule
\texttt{11\_gf\_derivation.tex} & 119--127 & $G_F = g^2/(4\sqrt{2}M_W^2)$ via $v$ \\
\texttt{docs/GF\_CONSTRAINT\_NOTE.md} & B.2--B.3 & $v$ defined from $G_F$ \\
\texttt{docs/STATUS.md} & 38 & G\_F marked ``circular'' \\
\texttt{docs/TODO.md} & 17 & ``Derive G\_F without circular input'' \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{center}

\subsection{What IS Independent}

\begin{itemize}
    \item $\sin^2\theta_W = 1/4$ from $\mathbb{Z}_6$ subgroup counting \tagDer{}
    \item $\alpha = 1/137.036$ \tagBL{} (measured independently of $G_F$)
    \item $m_e = 0.511$ MeV \tagBL{} (measured independently)
    \item $\delta = \hbar/(2m_p c) = 0.105$ fm \tagDc{}
\end{itemize}

% ============================================================================
\section{Step 1: Non-Circular Chain Definitions}

\subsection{The Forward Chain (No $v$ Allowed)}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=green!5!white, colframe=green!75!black, title=Non-Circular Derivation Chain]
\begin{equation}
\boxed{
\text{5D Action} \xrightarrow{\text{norm}} g_5
\xrightarrow{\text{KK}} M_{\text{eff}}
\xrightarrow{\text{BVP}} \{w_L, w_R, w_\phi\}
\xrightarrow{\text{overlap}} I_4
\xrightarrow{\text{assemble}} G_F^{\text{EDC}}
}
\end{equation}
\end{tcolorbox}

\subsection{Definitions}

\paragraph{5D Gauge Coupling $g_5$:}
From canonical normalization of 5D gauge action:
\begin{equation}
    S_{5D} = \int d^5x \sqrt{-g} \left( -\frac{1}{4g_5^2} F_{MN}F^{MN} \right)
\end{equation}
Dimension: $[g_5^2] = [\text{length}] = [\text{energy}]^{-1}$ \tagP{}

\paragraph{Effective Mediator Mass $M_{\text{eff}}$:}
From KK reduction along extra dimension:
\begin{equation}
    M_{\text{eff}}^2 = \lambda_0 \cdot \frac{1}{\delta^2}
\end{equation}
where $\lambda_0$ is the lowest massive KK eigenvalue (dimensionless). \tagOPEN{}

\paragraph{Mode Profiles $w_L(\chi), w_R(\chi), w_\phi(\chi)$:}
Solutions to the thick-brane Dirac/KG equations with asymmetric mass profile.
Normalization: $\int d\chi |w|^2 = 1$. \tagOPEN{}

\paragraph{Overlap Integral $I_4$:}
\begin{equation}
    I_4 := \int d\chi \, w_L(\chi)^2 \, w_R(\chi)^2 \, w_\phi(\chi)^2
    \label{eq:I4_def}
\end{equation}
Dimension: $[I_4] = [\text{length}]^{-1} = [\text{energy}]$. \tagOPEN{}

\paragraph{Effective 4D Coupling $g_{\text{eff}}$:}
\begin{equation}
    g_{\text{eff}}^2 = g_5^2 \cdot I_g
\end{equation}
where $I_g = \int d\chi \, w_\phi^2$ is the gauge boson overlap. \tagDc{}

\paragraph{Final Assembly:}
\begin{equation}
    \boxed{G_F^{\text{EDC}} = \frac{g_{\text{eff}}^2}{4\sqrt{2} M_{\text{eff}}^2}}
    \label{eq:GF_EDC}
\end{equation}

% ============================================================================
\section{Step 2A: Derivable Skeleton (No BVP Needed)}

\subsection{Dimensional Skeleton \tagDer{}}

Using dimensional analysis alone:
\begin{align}
    [G_F] &= [\text{energy}]^{-2} \\
    [g_5^2] &= [\text{length}] = [\text{energy}]^{-1} \\
    [I_4] &= [\text{energy}] \\
    [M_{\text{eff}}^2] &= [\text{energy}]^2
\end{align}

Therefore the \textbf{unique dimensionally correct combination} is:
\begin{equation}
    \boxed{G_F^{\text{EDC}} = C \cdot \frac{g_5^2 \cdot I_4}{M_{\text{eff}}^2}}
    \label{eq:GF_skeleton}
\end{equation}
where $C$ is a numerical factor from conventions ($C = 1/4\sqrt{2}$ for SM normalization).

\subsection{Dimensionless Form \tagDer{}}

Define the dimensionless target:
\begin{equation}
    X := G_F m_e^2 = 3.04 \times 10^{-12} \quad \tagBL{}
\end{equation}

Then the EDC prediction is:
\begin{equation}
    \boxed{X_{\text{EDC}} = C \cdot \frac{g_5^2 \cdot I_4 \cdot m_e^2}{M_{\text{eff}}^2}}
    \label{eq:X_EDC}
\end{equation}

\subsection{Reduction Using EDC Scales \tagDc{}}

If $M_{\text{eff}} \sim 1/\delta$ and $g_5^2 \sim \delta$ (natural 5D scaling):
\begin{equation}
    X_{\text{EDC}} \sim C \cdot \delta \cdot I_4 \cdot m_e^2 \cdot \delta^2 = C \cdot I_4 \cdot m_e^2 \cdot \delta^3
\end{equation}

With $\delta = 0.105$ fm $= 5.3 \times 10^{-4}$ GeV$^{-1}$:
\begin{equation}
    X_{\text{EDC}} \sim C \cdot I_4 \cdot (0.511 \text{ MeV})^2 \cdot (5.3 \times 10^{-4} \text{ GeV}^{-1})^3
\end{equation}

\textbf{Key insight:} The $\delta^3$ factor provides enormous suppression, potentially explaining the smallness of $G_F$.

% ============================================================================
\section{Step 2B: BVP-Dependent Layer (Falsification Gates)}

\subsection{What BVP Must Output}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lll}
\toprule
\textbf{Quantity} & \textbf{Definition} & \textbf{Status} \\
\midrule
$w_L(\chi)$ & Left-handed fermion mode & \tagOPEN{} \\
$w_R(\chi)$ & Right-handed fermion mode & \tagOPEN{} \\
$w_\phi(\chi)$ & Mediator (scalar/gauge) mode & \tagOPEN{} \\
$\lambda_0$ & Lowest massive KK eigenvalue & \tagOPEN{} \\
$I_4$ & Overlap integral \eqref{eq:I4_def} & \tagOPEN{} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{center}

\subsection{Falsification Gates}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=red!5!white, colframe=red!75!black, title=Falsification Criteria (P3-3)]
\textbf{FAIL conditions:}
\begin{enumerate}
    \item \textbf{Overlap mismatch:} $I_4$ from BVP differs from constraint window by $>10\times$
    \begin{equation}
        \text{FAIL if } I_4^{\text{BVP}} \notin [0.1, 10] \times I_4^{\text{required}}
    \end{equation}

    \item \textbf{Mass inconsistency:} $M_{\text{eff}}$ violates brane-thickness scaling
    \begin{equation}
        \text{FAIL if } M_{\text{eff}} \notin [0.1, 10] \times (1/\delta)
    \end{equation}

    \item \textbf{Coupling incompatibility:} $g_5$ from action contradicts $\sin^2\theta_W = 1/4$
    \begin{equation}
        \text{FAIL if } g_{\text{eff}}^2 \neq (4\pi\alpha/\sin^2\theta_W) \times f(\text{overlaps})
    \end{equation}
    with $f \sim O(1)$.
\end{enumerate}
\end{tcolorbox}

\subsection{Success Criteria}

\begin{equation}
    \text{SUCCESS: } \left| \frac{X_{\text{EDC}} - X_{\text{target}}}{X_{\text{target}}} \right| < 0.1 \quad (\pm 10\%)
\end{equation}

% ============================================================================
\section{Step 3: Toy Model Bounds (Feasibility Window)}

\subsection{Simplified Ansatz}

Assume exponential mode profiles with width $\sigma$:
\begin{align}
    w_L(\chi) &= \sqrt{\frac{1}{\sigma}} e^{-\chi/(2\sigma)} \\
    w_R(\chi) &= \sqrt{\frac{1}{\sigma}} e^{-(\chi - d)/(2\sigma)} \quad \text{(displaced by } d\text{)} \\
    w_\phi(\chi) &= \sqrt{\frac{1}{\delta}} e^{-\chi/(2\delta)}
\end{align}

\subsection{Chirality Suppression Factor}

The left-right overlap:
\begin{equation}
    \varepsilon := \int d\chi \, w_L w_R = e^{-d/(2\sigma)}
\end{equation}

For $d \gg \sigma$: $\varepsilon \ll 1$ (chirality separation).

\subsection{Overlap Integral Estimate}

For the four-point overlap:
\begin{equation}
    I_4 \sim \frac{\varepsilon^2}{\sigma} \quad \text{(rough estimate)}
\end{equation}

\subsection{Required $\varepsilon$ for Target Window}

From \eqref{eq:X_EDC}, matching $X_{\text{target}} = 3 \times 10^{-12}$ requires:
\begin{equation}
    I_4^{\text{required}} \sim \frac{X_{\text{target}}}{C \cdot g_5^2 \cdot m_e^2 / M_{\text{eff}}^2}
\end{equation}

With $M_{\text{eff}} \sim 1/\delta \sim 1.9$ GeV and $g_5^2 \sim 4\pi\alpha\delta$:
\begin{equation}
    I_4^{\text{required}} \sim 4 \times 10^{-5} \text{ GeV}^2 \sim (6 \text{ MeV})^2
\end{equation}

\textbf{Feasibility:} This scale is consistent with fermion localization at $\sim r_e^{-1}$.

\subsection{Toy Window Summary}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lll}
\toprule
\textbf{Parameter} & \textbf{Range for $X_{\text{EDC}} \approx X_{\text{target}}$} & \textbf{Status} \\
\midrule
$\varepsilon$ (chirality suppression) & $10^{-3}$ -- $10^{-2}$ & Plausible \\
$\sigma/\delta$ (localization ratio) & $0.01$ -- $0.1$ & Plausible \\
$M_{\text{eff}}$ & $1$ -- $10$ GeV & Plausible \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{center}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=yellow!10!white, colframe=yellow!75!black, title=Toy Model Caveat]
This is a \textbf{feasibility window}, not an EDC derivation.
The actual values must come from the thick-brane BVP solution (OPR-21).
\end{tcolorbox}

% ============================================================================
\section{Summary}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=green!5!white, colframe=green!75!black, title=P3-3 Framework Summary]
\textbf{Non-circular formula:}
\begin{equation}
    \boxed{X_{\text{EDC}} = \frac{g_5^2 \cdot I_4 \cdot m_e^2}{4\sqrt{2} \, M_{\text{eff}}^2}}
\end{equation}

\textbf{What is derived:}
\begin{itemize}
    \item Dimensional skeleton \tagDer{}
    \item Independence from $v$ \tagDer{}
    \item $\sin^2\theta_W = 1/4$ (separate prediction) \tagDer{}
\end{itemize}

\textbf{What is conditional [Dc]:}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $g_5$ from 5D action normalization (OPR-19)
    \item $M_{\text{eff}}$ from KK eigenvalue (OPR-20)
\end{itemize}

\textbf{What is OPEN (BVP-gated):}
\begin{itemize}
    \item Mode profiles $w_L, w_R, w_\phi$ (OPR-21)
    \item Overlap integral $I_4$
    \item Numerical $G_F^{\text{EDC}}$ value
\end{itemize}
\end{tcolorbox}

\subsection{Epistemic Assessment}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lcc}
